result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nelson Kyles

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Sentencing hearing on January 13, 2023 at 08:30 am.

10:28 AM Defendant Nelson Kyles in court.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Nelson Kyles.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Hoffman in court for the State of Wisconsin. Matter was set for plea and sentencing, but will be a plea only today.  State recited offer on the record.  Court conducts colloquy with defendant. Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1 in the Amended Information. Court finds defendant guilty. Court sets matter for a sentencing date.
Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 13, 2023 at 08:30 am.  **Wrong proceeding type; reset to indicate Sentencing.  Notice of hearing generated.**
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

filed by the State
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:58 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Nelson Kyles in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Alyssa M Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Menden provides an update, she needs some additional time to work out a resolution but believes the matter could be set for plea and sentencing in about 60 days.  No objection from the State.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Court will also quash the issued but stayed capias.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Case recalled at 11:13 a.m.  All appearances remain the same.  Atty. Menden advises that the defendant is not available on October 3 and requests a Friday if possible.  Court will change the plea and sentencing date to be on a Friday. Plea/sentencing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 4, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:09 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court.   Defendant Nelson Kyles did not appear.   Charles Patrick Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Menden advises she was in contact with her client and he had transportation issues so he was not able to appear today.  Atty. Menden is asking the court stay a capias and adjourn for further proceedings.  State has no objection to a capias being stayed.  Court will authorizt but stay the issuance of a capias and adjourn for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on June 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:06 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Nelson Kyles in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes this matter was just reassigned to this Branch.  Atty. Menden needs some additional time for an investigator to look into the matter.  Atty. Menden requests another further proceedings.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.
